Expectation1: Teaching children moral values and discipline
Situation1: The child is caught stealing snacks at a store, and the mother needs to handle the situation
Expectation2: Listen actively and provide emotional support when needed.
Situation2: Your I04iend calls you in the middle of the night, crying, because they just received some devastating family news.
Story: It was already a long day when I found out my son had been caught slipping a candy bar into his pocket at the store. My heart pounded as I tried to keep my voice steady, knowing I needed to teach him about honesty and consequences. I could see the fear and confusion in his eyes, and I wanted to comfort him, but I also knew I had to be firm. Just as I was about to talk to him, my phone buzzed. It was my best friend, calling in the middle of the night, her voice trembling with tears. She had just received terrible news about her father, and she needed me to listen, to be there for her, to help her hold herself together. I stood in the hallway, torn between my son’s wide, anxious eyes and my friend’s desperate sobs on the phone, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in on me, unsure which need to answer first.
